id: government bond that may be issued by a regional, rather than national, authority
name: government bond that may be issued by a regional, rather than national, authority

id: For example, when a hurricane destroys the police and emergency services building, there is no time to go through the process of voter referendum. The local council must be able to borrow the money to set up provisional buildings and necessary equipment for police and emergency services so that the community is served in continuity.
name: For example, when a hurricane destroys the police and emergency services building, there is no time to go through the process of voter referendum. The local council must be able to borrow the money to set up provisional buildings and necessary equipment for police and emergency services so that the community is served in continuity.

id: bond whose coupon rate and principal amount are fixed at the time of origination or sale and remain constant while the security is outstanding
name: bond whose coupon rate and principal amount are fixed at the time of origination or sale and remain constant while the security is outstanding

id: bond that is part of a series of bonds formed by selling each interest payment and the principal amount of a bond as separate zero coupon bonds.
name: bond that is part of a series of bonds formed by selling each interest payment and the principal amount of a bond as separate zero coupon bonds.

id: indicates the convention used to determine how the redemption is allocated over the set of bond holders
name: indicates the convention used to determine how the redemption is allocated over the set of bond holders

id: indicates the amount of the call on the first call date as specified in the call schedule
name: indicates the amount of the call on the first call date as specified in the call schedule

id: Full faith and credit bonds are typically backed by a government entity and are considered low risk.
name: Full faith and credit bonds are typically backed by a government entity and are considered low risk.

id: bond issued by the government of a country
name: bond issued by the government of a country

id: Tax increment bonds, also known as tax allocation bonds, often are used to finance the redevelopment of blighted areas.
name: Tax increment bonds, also known as tax allocation bonds, often are used to finance the redevelopment of blighted areas.

id: bond issued specifically to fund climate or environmental projects
name: bond issued specifically to fund climate or environmental projects

id: repayment event involving payment of a bond's principal amount at maturity or when it is called
name: repayment event involving payment of a bond's principal amount at maturity or when it is called

id: This is important since the securities processing area needs to start its procedures in anticipation of maturity. For zero coupon bonds, it is the last compounding date prior to maturity.
name: This is important since the securities processing area needs to start its procedures in anticipation of maturity. For zero coupon bonds, it is the last compounding date prior to maturity.

id: The adjustments to the interest rate (coupon) are made periodically, usually on a quarterly or monthly basis, and are tied to a certain money-market index. Also known as a "floater". For example six months USD LIBOR + 0.20%.
name: The adjustments to the interest rate (coupon) are made periodically, usually on a quarterly or monthly basis, and are tied to a certain money-market index. Also known as a "floater". For example six months USD LIBOR + 0.20%.

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate references to the exercise conventions ontology, which are not needed for bonds.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate references to the exercise conventions ontology, which are not needed for bonds.

id: A municipal security is typically a bond, note, warrant, certificate or other similar obligation issued by a state or local government or their agencies or authorities (such as cities, towns, villages, counties or special districts or authorities). A prime feature of most municipal securities is that interest or other investment earnings on them are generally excluded from gross income of the bondholder for federal income tax purposes. Some municipal securities are subject to federal income tax, although the issuers or bondholders may receive other federal tax advantages for certain types of taxable municipal securities. Some examples include Build America Bonds, municipal fund securities and direct pay subsidy bonds.
name: A municipal security is typically a bond, note, warrant, certificate or other similar obligation issued by a state or local government or their agencies or authorities (such as cities, towns, villages, counties or special districts or authorities). A prime feature of most municipal securities is that interest or other investment earnings on them are generally excluded from gross income of the bondholder for federal income tax purposes. Some municipal securities are subject to federal income tax, although the issuers or bondholders may receive other federal tax advantages for certain types of taxable municipal securities. Some examples include Build America Bonds, municipal fund securities and direct pay subsidy bonds.

id: short-term obligation to repay a specified principal amount on a certain date, together with interest at a stated rate, usually payable from a defined source of anticipated revenues
name: short-term obligation to repay a specified principal amount on a certain date, together with interest at a stated rate, usually payable from a defined source of anticipated revenues

id: Sovereign bonds issued by G20 developed countries are generally full faith and credit obligations. Sovereign bonds issued by emerging and developing countries may be issued in local currency or a G7 currency, and may either be full faith and credit (unsecured) or secured.
name: Sovereign bonds issued by G20 developed countries are generally full faith and credit obligations. Sovereign bonds issued by emerging and developing countries may be issued in local currency or a G7 currency, and may either be full faith and credit (unsecured) or secured.

id: specifies the initial price at which the holder may sell the bond to the issuer prior to maturity
name: specifies the initial price at which the holder may sell the bond to the issuer prior to maturity

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move details regarding step schedules to the debt instruments ontology for broader use and deprecate the use of a 'coupon' schedule in favor of interest payment schedule, which is the more modern terminology, aligning with other uses of the related terms in FIBO (FBC-317).
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move details regarding step schedules to the debt instruments ontology for broader use and deprecate the use of a 'coupon' schedule in favor of interest payment schedule, which is the more modern terminology, aligning with other uses of the related terms in FIBO (FBC-317).

id: Notes usually mature in one year or less, although notes of longer maturities are also issued.
name: Notes usually mature in one year or less, although notes of longer maturities are also issued.

id: bond whose principal adjusts over time with changes in an index
name: bond whose principal adjusts over time with changes in an index

id: municipal bond used to fund a development project that is payable from the revenues of an assessment (tax) on the community that is intended to benefit from the project
name: municipal bond used to fund a development project that is payable from the revenues of an assessment (tax) on the community that is intended to benefit from the project

id: This is the price a bond issuer or preferred stock issuer must pay investors to buy back, or call, all or part of an issue before the maturity date.
name: This is the price a bond issuer or preferred stock issuer must pay investors to buy back, or call, all or part of an issue before the maturity date.

id: specifies the last coupon payment prior to maturity
name: specifies the last coupon payment prior to maturity

id: bond issued by a company in order to raise financing
name: bond issued by a company in order to raise financing

id: bond with a coupon that increases (steps up) while the bond is outstanding
name: bond with a coupon that increases (steps up) while the bond is outstanding

id: call of part of an issue
name: call of part of an issue

id: Medium term notes are typically issued by corporations and financial institutions, although GSEs also have MTN programs. MTNs may be issued under a shelf registration program which allows the company to issue bonds over time with varying maturities and coupons. Companies issue MTNs to have a more flexible source of funding. They may also issue MTN in response to 'reverse inquiry' by investors looking for bonds with specific maturities, issue size and coupon.
name: Medium term notes are typically issued by corporations and financial institutions, although GSEs also have MTN programs. MTNs may be issued under a shelf registration program which allows the company to issue bonds over time with varying maturities and coupons. Companies issue MTNs to have a more flexible source of funding. They may also issue MTN in response to 'reverse inquiry' by investors looking for bonds with specific maturities, issue size and coupon.

id: indicates the premium paid to a bond holder when the bond is called
name: indicates the premium paid to a bond holder when the bond is called

id: The issuer typically has to make a lump sum payment to the investor(s) derived from a formula based on the net present value (NPV) of future coupon payments that will not be paid incrementally because of the call combined with the principal payment the investor would have received at maturity.
name: The issuer typically has to make a lump sum payment to the investor(s) derived from a formula based on the net present value (NPV) of future coupon payments that will not be paid incrementally because of the call combined with the principal payment the investor would have received at maturity.

id: call allowing the issuer to pay off remaining debt early
name: call allowing the issuer to pay off remaining debt early

id: or redemption amount which is calculated by reference to the Inflation Index, with a maturity date which falls on the same day as the Maturity Date of the Inflation Linked Notes, or such other date as the Calculation Agent shall select if there is no such bond maturing on the Maturity Date of the Inflation Linked Notes. If any bond so selected is redeemed, the Calculation Agent will select a new Fallback Bond on the same basis, but selected from all eligible bonds in issue at the time the original Fallback Bond is redeemed (including any bond for which the redeemed bond is exchanged). Note the rate of the fallback bond is used as a substitute for the inflation index if, for example, it is no longer published.
name: or redemption amount which is calculated by reference to the Inflation Index, with a maturity date which falls on the same day as the Maturity Date of the Inflation Linked Notes, or such other date as the Calculation Agent shall select if there is no such bond maturing on the Maturity Date of the Inflation Linked Notes. If any bond so selected is redeemed, the Calculation Agent will select a new Fallback Bond on the same basis, but selected from all eligible bonds in issue at the time the original Fallback Bond is redeemed (including any bond for which the redeemed bond is exchanged). Note the rate of the fallback bond is used as a substitute for the inflation index if, for example, it is no longer published.

id: financial institution with trust powers, designated by the issuer, that acts, pursuant to a bond contract, in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit of the bondholders in enforcing the terms of the bond contract
name: financial institution with trust powers, designated by the issuer, that acts, pursuant to a bond contract, in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit of the bondholders in enforcing the terms of the bond contract

id: indicates the final payment date of a financial instrument, at which point the principal (and all remaining interest) is due to be paid
name: indicates the final payment date of a financial instrument, at which point the principal (and all remaining interest) is due to be paid

id: short-term zero coupon treasury obligation with a maturity ranging from one to twelve months
name: short-term zero coupon treasury obligation with a maturity ranging from one to twelve months

id: bond whose income may vary over time, because either the coupon rate or principal amount changes in line with an index or schedule over the life of the security
name: bond whose income may vary over time, because either the coupon rate or principal amount changes in line with an index or schedule over the life of the security

id: terms for payment of interest on a bond with a fixed interest rate
name: terms for payment of interest on a bond with a fixed interest rate

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate a duplicate 'isBasedOn' property and replace it with the property of the same name in the debt ontology, to revise the inheritance hierarchy for bond conversion terms to reflect changes in the representation of redemption more generally, to reflect the move of redemption provision from debt to financial instruments, and eliminate circular and ambiguous definitions.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate a duplicate 'isBasedOn' property and replace it with the property of the same name in the debt ontology, to revise the inheritance hierarchy for bond conversion terms to reflect changes in the representation of redemption more generally, to reflect the move of redemption provision from debt to financial instruments, and eliminate circular and ambiguous definitions.

id: The remarketing agent also typically is responsible for resetting the interest rate for a variable rate issue and may act as tender agent.
name: The remarketing agent also typically is responsible for resetting the interest rate for a variable rate issue and may act as tender agent.

id: At present there is only a schedule, there should be other terms for what happens on the scheduled dates. Sinking fund may be bullet e.g. x percent over year for y years. SF may be mandatory or contingent on some other economic event.
name: At present there is only a schedule, there should be other terms for what happens on the scheduled dates. Sinking fund may be bullet e.g. x percent over year for y years. SF may be mandatory or contingent on some other economic event.

id: bond issued by a government sponsored agency or corporation rather than by the government directly
name: bond issued by a government sponsored agency or corporation rather than by the government directly

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate false positives in hygiene tests due to concept names containing words, such as 'and', which might indicate that the concept actually reflects more than one thing, including distinguishing zero coupon from original issue discount bonds, and replace the use of call price and put price, which are overly constrained, with monetary price.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate false positives in hygiene tests due to concept names containing words, such as 'and', which might indicate that the concept actually reflects more than one thing, including distinguishing zero coupon from original issue discount bonds, and replace the use of call price and put price, which are overly constrained, with monetary price.

id: tradable debt instrument representing a loan in which the issuer owes the holder(s) a debt
name: tradable debt instrument representing a loan in which the issuer owes the holder(s) a debt

id: supranational organizations such as the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) may also be considered corporate bonds rather than government bonds.
name: supranational organizations such as the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) may also be considered corporate bonds rather than government bonds.

id: The principal on variable principal bonds adjusts line with an index such as inflation or GDP. For example, for a bond linked to the CPI, if inflation rises two percent the principal increases by 2 percent. The coupon rate is typically fixed. The best-known example is TIPS or Treasury Inflation Protected Bonds, which are linked to the CPI. TIPs offer a real or inflation adjusted rate of return.
name: The principal on variable principal bonds adjusts line with an index such as inflation or GDP. For example, for a bond linked to the CPI, if inflation rises two percent the principal increases by 2 percent. The coupon rate is typically fixed. The best-known example is TIPS or Treasury Inflation Protected Bonds, which are linked to the CPI. TIPs offer a real or inflation adjusted rate of return.

id: specifies the financial institution with trust powers, designated by the issuer, that acts, pursuant to a bond contract, in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit of the bondholders in enforcing the terms of the bond contract
name: specifies the financial institution with trust powers, designated by the issuer, that acts, pursuant to a bond contract, in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit of the bondholders in enforcing the terms of the bond contract

id: indicates the recurring window of time in which the put feature can be exercised
name: indicates the recurring window of time in which the put feature can be exercised

id: bond that is backed by collateral, such as a tangible asset or income stream, in addition to a general promise to pay
name: bond that is backed by collateral, such as a tangible asset or income stream, in addition to a general promise to pay

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the refactored definition of a listing and improve the definition of corporate bond.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to reflect the refactored definition of a listing and improve the definition of corporate bond.

id: indicates the amount of the principal paid with a redemption payment
name: indicates the amount of the principal paid with a redemption payment

id: bond whose income may vary over time, because either the coupon rate or principal amount is related to a specific index, such as the Consumer Price Index
name: bond whose income may vary over time, because either the coupon rate or principal amount is related to a specific index, such as the Consumer Price Index

id: convention used to determine how the partial call will be actioned with respect to bond selection
name: convention used to determine how the partial call will be actioned with respect to bond selection

id: indicates the period of time for which a callable security cannot be called and only interest coupon payments are received by the security holder
name: indicates the period of time for which a callable security cannot be called and only interest coupon payments are received by the security holder

id: indicates the minimum variable interest payment amount
name: indicates the minimum variable interest payment amount

id: bond issue whereby the issue includes a warrant
name: bond issue whereby the issue includes a warrant

id: rate basis calculated as a percentage of cumulative average value
name: rate basis calculated as a percentage of cumulative average value

id: municipal bond supported by the revenue from a specific project
name: municipal bond supported by the revenue from a specific project

id: convention involving an impartial lottery for determining which securities are subject to partial call or partial redemption
name: convention involving an impartial lottery for determining which securities are subject to partial call or partial redemption

id: formula for the calculation of variable interest
name: formula for the calculation of variable interest

id: The term 'gilt' or 'gilt-edged security' is a reference to the primary characteristic of gilts as an investment: their security. This is a reflection of the fact that the British Government has never failed to make interest or principal payments on gilts as they fall due.
name: The term 'gilt' or 'gilt-edged security' is a reference to the primary characteristic of gilts as an investment: their security. This is a reflection of the fact that the British Government has never failed to make interest or principal payments on gilts as they fall due.

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address text formatting hygiene issues.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address text formatting hygiene issues.

id: The principal amount accretes over time at a constant accrual rate and is redeemed at full face value at maturity. In effect, the accrual rate is the coupon rate or yield which is added to the outstanding principal rather than being paid out to investors.
name: The principal amount accretes over time at a constant accrual rate and is redeemed at full face value at maturity. In effect, the accrual rate is the coupon rate or yield which is added to the outstanding principal rather than being paid out to investors.

id: terms indicating when a convertible bond can be converted to another security (usually a publicly traded share issued by of the same issuer)
name: terms indicating when a convertible bond can be converted to another security (usually a publicly traded share issued by of the same issuer)

id: Zero coupon bonds and OID bonds are callable at an accreted value.
name: Zero coupon bonds and OID bonds are callable at an accreted value.

id: coupon payment terms for securities with a coupon that increases (steps up) while the bond is outstanding
name: coupon payment terms for securities with a coupon that increases (steps up) while the bond is outstanding

id: scheduled date for the first regular coupon payment, in a regular repeating series of coupon periods, after any non standard (long or short) first coupon period in the schedule
name: scheduled date for the first regular coupon payment, in a regular repeating series of coupon periods, after any non standard (long or short) first coupon period in the schedule

id: bond secured by revenues derived from designated taxes other than ad valorem taxes
name: bond secured by revenues derived from designated taxes other than ad valorem taxes

id: Municipal bonds may be issued by states, cities, counties, special tax districts or special agencies or authorities of state or local governments.
name: Municipal bonds may be issued by states, cities, counties, special tax districts or special agencies or authorities of state or local governments.

id: A special assessment is a charge imposed against a property in a particular locality because that property receives a special benefit by virtue of some public improvement, separate and apart from the general benefit accruing to the public at large. Special assessments may be apportioned according to the value of the benefit received, rather than merely the cost of the improvement.
name: A special assessment is a charge imposed against a property in a particular locality because that property receives a special benefit by virtue of some public improvement, separate and apart from the general benefit accruing to the public at large. Special assessments may be apportioned according to the value of the benefit received, rather than merely the cost of the improvement.

id: contractual terms specifying the calculation of the interest rate for a variable coupon bond
name: contractual terms specifying the calculation of the interest rate for a variable coupon bond

id: indicates the first date on which the bond may be called at par for redemption
name: indicates the first date on which the bond may be called at par for redemption

id: indicates whether the coupon is pro rated to the actual number of days in the payment period versus the number of payment periods
name: indicates whether the coupon is pro rated to the actual number of days in the payment period versus the number of payment periods

id: If a private investor wishes to purchase gilts the secondary market can be accessed through a stockbroker, bank or the DMO's Purchase and Sale Service.
name: If a private investor wishes to purchase gilts the secondary market can be accessed through a stockbroker, bank or the DMO's Purchase and Sale Service.

id: bond secured by an unconditional promise to pay by another entity
name: bond secured by an unconditional promise to pay by another entity

id: specifies the amount of the call on the first par call date as specified in the call schedule
name: specifies the amount of the call on the first par call date as specified in the call schedule

id: bond that may be traded on an exchange
name: bond that may be traded on an exchange

id: The pricing of T-bills is unique among U.S. government debt issues. Treasury bills are offered in multiples of $100 and in terms ranging from a few days to 52 weeks. Rather than providing interest payments as Treasury Bonds or Notes do, T-bills are sold at a discount, and the entire return is realized upon maturity. The price of a bill is determined at auction. The annualized interest rate earned on T-bills is equal to the difference between the purchase price and maturity value, divided by the maturity value.
name: The pricing of T-bills is unique among U.S. government debt issues. Treasury bills are offered in multiples of $100 and in terms ranging from a few days to 52 weeks. Rather than providing interest payments as Treasury Bonds or Notes do, T-bills are sold at a discount, and the entire return is realized upon maturity. The price of a bill is determined at auction. The annualized interest rate earned on T-bills is equal to the difference between the purchase price and maturity value, divided by the maturity value.

id: Not the same as principal paydown. This is when the principal itself varies over time, usually as a result of being defined in relation to some index such as an inflation index. Forms the debt principal in instruments such as inflation bonds.
name: Not the same as principal paydown. This is when the principal itself varies over time, usually as a result of being defined in relation to some index such as an inflation index. Forms the debt principal in instruments such as inflation bonds.

id: Fannie Mae also issues zero-coupon callable debt securities. Zero-coupon notes are debt securities on which no coupon interest is paid to the investor. Rather, the security is purchased at a discounted dollar price and matures at par. If the option on a callable zero-coupon security is exercised, it is redeemed at a higher dollar price than the original issue price. The yield for a callable zero-coupon security is based on the difference between the original discounted price and the principal payment at the call date.
name: Fannie Mae also issues zero-coupon callable debt securities. Zero-coupon notes are debt securities on which no coupon interest is paid to the investor. Rather, the security is purchased at a discounted dollar price and matures at par. If the option on a callable zero-coupon security is exercised, it is redeemed at a higher dollar price than the original issue price. The yield for a callable zero-coupon security is based on the difference between the original discounted price and the principal payment at the call date.

id: indicates the initial date on which the holder may sell the bond to the issuer prior to maturity
name: indicates the initial date on which the holder may sell the bond to the issuer prior to maturity

id: bond whose entire principal value is paid on the maturity date, rather than amortized over its lifetime
name: bond whose entire principal value is paid on the maturity date, rather than amortized over its lifetime

id: For example, bonds for a particular purpose might be supported by sales, cigarette, fuel or business license taxes.
name: For example, bonds for a particular purpose might be supported by sales, cigarette, fuel or business license taxes.

id: implicit full faith and credit bond
name: implicit full faith and credit bond

id: or transfer agent for the bonds.
name: or transfer agent for the bonds.

id: indicates the amount of the call on the specified call date, typically the sum of par value and the call premium, as specified in the contract
name: indicates the amount of the call on the specified call date, typically the sum of par value and the call premium, as specified in the contract

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC and eliminate a redundant superclass from RegularCouponSchedule.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to eliminate duplication of concepts in LCC and eliminate a redundant superclass from RegularCouponSchedule.

id: A bond that is bank qualified is also known as a qualified tax-exempt obligation.
name: A bond that is bank qualified is also known as a qualified tax-exempt obligation.

id: The conversion ratio at maturity reflects the equity price and par value of the bond when issued. There is also typically a second higher conversion ratio if the equity price rises above the strike during the term of the bond.
name: The conversion ratio at maturity reflects the equity price and par value of the bond when issued. There is also typically a second higher conversion ratio if the equity price rises above the strike during the term of the bond.

id: Revenue bonds are municipal bonds that finance income-producing projects, such as toll bridges, highways, or local stadiums, and are secured by a specified revenue source. Typically, revenue bonds can be issued by any government agency or fund that is managed in the manner of a business, such as entities having both operating revenues and expenses.
name: Revenue bonds are municipal bonds that finance income-producing projects, such as toll bridges, highways, or local stadiums, and are secured by a specified revenue source. Typically, revenue bonds can be issued by any government agency or fund that is managed in the manner of a business, such as entities having both operating revenues and expenses.

id: Most unsecured bonds pose limited risk of default, as the organizations that issue them are typically financially sound.
name: Most unsecured bonds pose limited risk of default, as the organizations that issue them are typically financially sound.

id: indicates whether or not a given municipal bond conforms with section 265(b)(3) of the IRS tax code; when purchased by a commercial bank for its portfolio, such designation allows the bank to deduct a portion of the interest cost of carry for the position
name: indicates whether or not a given municipal bond conforms with section 265(b)(3) of the IRS tax code; when purchased by a commercial bank for its portfolio, such designation allows the bank to deduct a portion of the interest cost of carry for the position

id: terms that include a schedule for repayment of the principal over the lifetime of the bond, typically in equal payments at regular intervals
name: terms that include a schedule for repayment of the principal over the lifetime of the bond, typically in equal payments at regular intervals

id: indicates the source of funds for a new issue of municipal securities
name: indicates the source of funds for a new issue of municipal securities

id: terms for the repayment of the principal on a bond
name: terms for the repayment of the principal on a bond

id: bond with a variable interest rate based on a published reference interest rate
name: bond with a variable interest rate based on a published reference interest rate

id: The first coupon payment period can be long or short when this date doesn't coincide with the start of a normal coupon payment period.
name: The first coupon payment period can be long or short when this date doesn't coincide with the start of a normal coupon payment period.

id: The principal amount accretes over time at a constant accrual rate and is redeemed at full face value at maturity.
name: The principal amount accretes over time at a constant accrual rate and is redeemed at full face value at maturity.

id: terms for payment of interest on a zero coupon bond
name: terms for payment of interest on a zero coupon bond

id: bond payable from the incremental increase in tax revenues realized from any increase in property value and other economic activity, often designed to capture the economic benefit resulting from a bond financing
name: bond payable from the incremental increase in tax revenues realized from any increase in property value and other economic activity, often designed to capture the economic benefit resulting from a bond financing

id: A medium-term note (MTN) is a debt note that usually matures (is paid back) in 5 to 10 years, but the term may be less than one year or as long as 100 years. They can be issued on a fixed or floating coupon basis.
name: A medium-term note (MTN) is a debt note that usually matures (is paid back) in 5 to 10 years, but the term may be less than one year or as long as 100 years. They can be issued on a fixed or floating coupon basis.

id: debt instrument issued by HM Treasury and listed on the London Stock Exchange
name: debt instrument issued by HM Treasury and listed on the London Stock Exchange

id: debt instrument issued by the United States Department of the Treasury that carries a full faith and credit guarantee
name: debt instrument issued by the United States Department of the Treasury that carries a full faith and credit guarantee

id: bond indexed to inflation so that the principal or interest payments rise and fall with the rate of inflation
name: bond indexed to inflation so that the principal or interest payments rise and fall with the rate of inflation

id: bond that is traded over the counter rather than via an exchange or other listing facility
name: bond that is traded over the counter rather than via an exchange or other listing facility

id: basis for a percentage quoted rate as used in specifying bond call percentage amounts
name: basis for a percentage quoted rate as used in specifying bond call percentage amounts

id: By shelf registration we mean the security registration process where an issuer registers in advance, and can issue lots of securities for up to three years.
name: By shelf registration we mean the security registration process where an issuer registers in advance, and can issue lots of securities for up to three years.

id: provision that gives a bond issuer the right to call its bonds due to an unusual one-time occurrence, as specified in the offering statement
name: provision that gives a bond issuer the right to call its bonds due to an unusual one-time occurrence, as specified in the offering statement

id: terms for the paydown of principal in a sinking fund type of amortizing security
name: terms for the paydown of principal in a sinking fund type of amortizing security

id: scheduled date of the last regular coupon payment, that is the last of the payments that are made according to a regular repeating series of coupon periods, before any non-standard (long or short) final coupon period in the schedule
name: scheduled date of the last regular coupon payment, that is the last of the payments that are made according to a regular repeating series of coupon periods, before any non-standard (long or short) final coupon period in the schedule

id: official statement specifying how the funds raised via a new issue of municipal securities are to be applied
name: official statement specifying how the funds raised via a new issue of municipal securities are to be applied

id: specifies the final date on which the issuer expects to make a final coupon payment
name: specifies the final date on which the issuer expects to make a final coupon payment

id: bond that regularly pays down the principal (face value) on the debt along with its interest expense over the life of the bond
name: bond that regularly pays down the principal (face value) on the debt along with its interest expense over the life of the bond

id: date on which a bond can be converted into the specified equity security
name: date on which a bond can be converted into the specified equity security

id: A secured bond may be collateralized by a claim on real assets, such as a factory or auto fleet; or by a claim on a revenue stream. A secured bond differs from a mortgage in that proceeds of the bond sale aren't used to acquire the asset.
name: A secured bond may be collateralized by a claim on real assets, such as a factory or auto fleet; or by a claim on a revenue stream. A secured bond differs from a mortgage in that proceeds of the bond sale aren't used to acquire the asset.

name: municipal securities dealer responsible for reselling to investors securities (such as variable rate demand obligations and other tender option bonds) that have been tendered for purchase by their owner

name: indicates the maximum variable interest payment amount

id: These bonds are typically asset-linked and backed by the issuer's balance sheet. Green bonds finance projects aimed at energy efficiency, pollution prevention, sustainable agriculture, fishery and forestry, the protection of aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems, clean transportation, sustainable water management and the cultivation of environmentally friendly technologies, and often include incentives such as tax exemption.
name: These bonds are typically asset-linked and backed by the issuer's balance sheet. Green bonds finance projects aimed at energy efficiency, pollution prevention, sustainable agriculture, fishery and forestry, the protection of aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems, clean transportation, sustainable water management and the cultivation of environmentally friendly technologies, and often include incentives such as tax exemption.

id: Bonds.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.
name: Bonds.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from several FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.

id: taxable municipal bond issued through December 31, 2010 under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (ARRA)
name: taxable municipal bond issued through December 31, 2010 under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (ARRA)

id: bond issued over time under a shelf registration program, where each issue may have a different coupon and maturity typically ranging from one to ten years
name: bond issued over time under a shelf registration program, where each issue may have a different coupon and maturity typically ranging from one to ten years

id: an expression used to determine a variable interest payment amount
name: an expression used to determine a variable interest payment amount

id: If the equity price remains below the strike price throughout the term of the bond it matures and is redeemed like a regular bond. The conversion ratio and strike price are usually set when the convertible bond is issued.
name: If the equity price remains below the strike price throughout the term of the bond it matures and is redeemed like a regular bond. The conversion ratio and strike price are usually set when the convertible bond is issued.

id: municipal security available to governing councils in case of emergency, such as a natural disaster, that needs immediate action without time for voter referendum
name: municipal security available to governing councils in case of emergency, such as a natural disaster, that needs immediate action without time for voter referendum

id: for each call event on the schedule, indicates whether the rate is expressed as a percentage of par or percentage of percentage of cumulative average value (CAV)
name: for each call event on the schedule, indicates whether the rate is expressed as a percentage of par or percentage of percentage of cumulative average value (CAV)

id: convertible bond that is also callable
name: convertible bond that is also callable

id: repayment schedule whereby a given percentage of a bond issue is redeemed on predefined dates
name: repayment schedule whereby a given percentage of a bond issue is redeemed on predefined dates

id: bond that has no maturity date, i.e., one that pays interest in perpetuity
name: bond that has no maturity date, i.e., one that pays interest in perpetuity

id: relates an index-linked instrument to a government bond that may be selected by a calculation agent
name: relates an index-linked instrument to a government bond that may be selected by a calculation agent

id: Super-sinker is a colloquial term for a term maturity, usually from a single family mortgage revenue issue with several term maturities, that will be the first to be called from a sinking fund into which all proceeds from prepayments of mortgages financed by the issue are deposited. The maturity's priority status under the call provisions means that it is likely to be redeemed in its entirety well before the stated maturity date.
name: Super-sinker is a colloquial term for a term maturity, usually from a single family mortgage revenue issue with several term maturities, that will be the first to be called from a sinking fund into which all proceeds from prepayments of mortgages financed by the issue are deposited. The maturity's priority status under the call provisions means that it is likely to be redeemed in its entirety well before the stated maturity date.

id: corporate bond program where the coupon rate on outstanding bonds is periodically reset through an auction process
name: corporate bond program where the coupon rate on outstanding bonds is periodically reset through an auction process

id: debt obligation issued by a regional governmental entity
name: debt obligation issued by a regional governmental entity

id: or to repay the principal at maturity. The most common bonds are corporate or governmental, typically used to finance specific projects or operations.
name: or to repay the principal at maturity. The most common bonds are corporate or governmental, typically used to finance specific projects or operations.

id: bond that is only secured by the bond issuer's good credit standing
name: bond that is only secured by the bond issuer's good credit standing

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to incorporate the concept of a credit agreement repaid at maturity, which is a component assumed to be part of the definition of a bond, and to add an explanatory note to the definition of Treasury Bill.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to incorporate the concept of a credit agreement repaid at maturity, which is a component assumed to be part of the definition of a bond, and to add an explanatory note to the definition of Treasury Bill.

id: Perpetual bonds function much like dividend-paying stocks or certain preferred securities. Just as the owner of the stock receives a dividend payment as long as the stock is held, the perpetual bond owner receives an interest payment as long as the bond is held.
name: Perpetual bonds function much like dividend-paying stocks or certain preferred securities. Just as the owner of the stock receives a dividend payment as long as the stock is held, the perpetual bond owner receives an interest payment as long as the bond is held.

id: fixed coupon bond issued by HM Treasury that guarantees to pay the holder of the gilt a fixed cash payment (coupon) every six months until the maturity date, at which point the holder receives the final coupon payment and the return of the principal
name: fixed coupon bond issued by HM Treasury that guarantees to pay the holder of the gilt a fixed cash payment (coupon) every six months until the maturity date, at which point the holder receives the final coupon payment and the return of the principal

id: call feature whereby the issuer can recall part of the issue on scheduled dates, where bonds are selected to be called according to some rule, or by selecting various bonds at random
name: call feature whereby the issuer can recall part of the issue on scheduled dates, where bonds are selected to be called according to some rule, or by selecting various bonds at random

id: Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities, or TIPS, provide protection against inflation. The principal of a TIPS increases with inflation and decreases with deflation, as measured by the Consumer Price Index. When a TIPS matures, you are paid the adjusted principal or original principal, whichever is greater.
name: Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities, or TIPS, provide protection against inflation. The principal of a TIPS increases with inflation and decreases with deflation, as measured by the Consumer Price Index. When a TIPS matures, you are paid the adjusted principal or original principal, whichever is greater.

id: bond issued with a coupon rate of zero and that trades at a deep discount to face value
name: bond issued with a coupon rate of zero and that trades at a deep discount to face value

id: This ontology defines the basic concept of a bond and a number of bond variants including convertible and callable bonds. Medium term notes (MTNs) and debentures are also defined.
name: This ontology defines the basic concept of a bond and a number of bond variants including convertible and callable bonds. Medium term notes (MTNs) and debentures are also defined.

id: an interest rate of zero (0) percent
name: an interest rate of zero (0) percent

id: insurance policy that a bond issuer purchases that guarantees the repayment of the principal and all associated interest payments to the bondholders in the event of default
name: insurance policy that a bond issuer purchases that guarantees the repayment of the principal and all associated interest payments to the bondholders in the event of default

id: principal that is defined in relation to some variable and so varies over time, as principal
name: principal that is defined in relation to some variable and so varies over time, as principal

id: bond based on the return on an equity over time, i.e. the price and dividend payments or the total return (similar to total return swaps)
name: bond based on the return on an equity over time, i.e. the price and dividend payments or the total return (similar to total return swaps)

id: Conventional gilts are the simplest form of government bond and constitute around 75 percent of the gilt portfolio.
name: Conventional gilts are the simplest form of government bond and constitute around 75 percent of the gilt portfolio.

id: interest rate on a debt security that the issuer promises to pay to the holder until maturity, expressed as an annual percentage of the face value
name: interest rate on a debt security that the issuer promises to pay to the holder until maturity, expressed as an annual percentage of the face value

id: party responsible for maintaining records on behalf of the issuer that identify the owners of a registered bond issue
name: party responsible for maintaining records on behalf of the issuer that identify the owners of a registered bond issue

id: indicates the date on which a security is subject to redemption by the bond holder
name: indicates the date on which a security is subject to redemption by the bond holder

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to allow for variation in index-linked bonds, such as those whose interest payments vary with an index in addition to those that have a variable principal linked to an index and to make a number of corrections to the class hierarchy.
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was revised to allow for variation in index-linked bonds, such as those whose interest payments vary with an index in addition to those that have a variable principal linked to an index and to make a number of corrections to the class hierarchy.

id: The first coupon date sometimes occurs at an irregular time; that is, if the bond pays coupons every six months, the first coupon period may be longer or shorter than six months.
name: The first coupon date sometimes occurs at an irregular time; that is, if the bond pays coupons every six months, the first coupon period may be longer or shorter than six months.

id: official statement identifying the source of funds for a new issue of municipal securities
name: official statement identifying the source of funds for a new issue of municipal securities

id: terms for repayment of the principal for a bond as a single payment covering the whole principal amount
name: terms for repayment of the principal for a bond as a single payment covering the whole principal amount

id: The step change may be one time, or occur according to a schedule or at regular intervals.
name: The step change may be one time, or occur according to a schedule or at regular intervals.

id: specifies the amount of the call on the first call date on which the bond may be called at a price above par as specified in the call schedule
name: specifies the amount of the call on the first call date on which the bond may be called at a price above par as specified in the call schedule

id: rate basis calculated as a percentage of par value
name: rate basis calculated as a percentage of par value

id: bond whereby amortization is via a known and published schedule
name: bond whereby amortization is via a known and published schedule

id: identifies the dealer responsible for reselling to investors securities (such as variable rate demand obligations and other tender option bonds) that have been tendered for purchase by their owner.
name: identifies the dealer responsible for reselling to investors securities (such as variable rate demand obligations and other tender option bonds) that have been tendered for purchase by their owner.

id: indicates that the bond has a long-term coupon but short potential short maturity
name: indicates that the bond has a long-term coupon but short potential short maturity

id: indicates whether a legal opinion exists for a given municipal bond
name: indicates whether a legal opinion exists for a given municipal bond

id: bond that includes a stipulation allowing the issuer the right to repurchase and retire the bond at the call price after the call protection period
name: bond that includes a stipulation allowing the issuer the right to repurchase and retire the bond at the call price after the call protection period

id: The rate adjusts according to a predetermined formula outlined in the bond's prospectus or official statement.
name: The rate adjusts according to a predetermined formula outlined in the bond's prospectus or official statement.

id: debt security issued by some government on behalf of some polity, including sovereign and municipal debt
name: debt security issued by some government on behalf of some polity, including sovereign and municipal debt

id: long term term coupon bearing treasury obligation issued in terms of 20 years or 30 years that pays interest every six months until they mature
name: long term term coupon bearing treasury obligation issued in terms of 20 years or 30 years that pays interest every six months until they mature

id: Inflation-linked bonds are primarily issued by sovereign governments, such as the U.S. and the UK.
name: Inflation-linked bonds are primarily issued by sovereign governments, such as the U.S. and the UK.

id: specifies the first date on which the issuer or its agent expects or commits to make a coupon payment
name: specifies the first date on which the issuer or its agent expects or commits to make a coupon payment

id: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add an optional restriction on bond for 'has series' (FBC-322).
name: Bonds.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add an optional restriction on bond for 'has series' (FBC-322).

id: convention whereby securities that are subject to partial redemption are allocated proportionately
name: convention whereby securities that are subject to partial redemption are allocated proportionately

id: bond coupon that has a variable interest rate
name: bond coupon that has a variable interest rate

id: The trustee under a bond contract often also acts as registrar.
name: The trustee under a bond contract often also acts as registrar.

id: medium term coupon bearing treasury obligation with original maturity ranging from two to ten years
name: medium term coupon bearing treasury obligation with original maturity ranging from two to ten years

id: convertible bond that converts into shares at maturity regardless of the equity price
name: convertible bond that converts into shares at maturity regardless of the equity price

id: debt instrument evidencing a pro rata share in a specific pledged revenue stream, usually lease payments by the issuer that are typically subject to annual appropriation
name: debt instrument evidencing a pro rata share in a specific pledged revenue stream, usually lease payments by the issuer that are typically subject to annual appropriation

id: Such redemptions may occur when bond proceeds are not spent according to schedule; when bond proceeds are used in a way that makes nontaxable bond interest taxable; or when a catastrophe destroys the project being financed, among other reasons.
name: Such redemptions may occur when bond proceeds are not spent according to schedule; when bond proceeds are used in a way that makes nontaxable bond interest taxable; or when a catastrophe destroys the project being financed, among other reasons.

id: A remarketing agent (dealer or underwriter) periodically surveys bond holders to identify those who want to sell bonds. The agent surveys market (or holds an auction) to determine interest rate at which the bonds can be resold. The rate on all outstanding bonds resets at the new rate. These programs are perpetual in the sense they often don't have a fixed maturity date, but the company can redeem them. If an auction fails, i.e., the agent can't place all the bonds then.
name: A remarketing agent (dealer or underwriter) periodically surveys bond holders to identify those who want to sell bonds. The agent surveys market (or holds an auction) to determine interest rate at which the bonds can be resold. The rate on all outstanding bonds resets at the new rate. These programs are perpetual in the sense they often don't have a fixed maturity date, but the company can redeem them. If an auction fails, i.e., the agent can't place all the bonds then.

id: terms for payment of interest on a bond
name: terms for payment of interest on a bond

id: indicates the difference between the stated redemption price at maturity and the issue price
name: indicates the difference between the stated redemption price at maturity and the issue price

id: A certificate of participation (COP) is a type of financing where an investor purchases a share of the lease revenues of a program rather than the bond being secured by those revenues. The certificate generally entitles the holder to receive a share, or participation, in the payments from a particular project. The payments are passed through the lessor to the certificate holders. The lessor typically assigns the lease and the payments to a trustee, which then distributes the payments to the certificate holders.
name: A certificate of participation (COP) is a type of financing where an investor purchases a share of the lease revenues of a program rather than the bond being secured by those revenues. The certificate generally entitles the holder to receive a share, or participation, in the payments from a particular project. The payments are passed through the lessor to the certificate holders. The lessor typically assigns the lease and the payments to a trustee, which then distributes the payments to the certificate holders.

id: relates the redemption provision of a debt instrument to one-time provision that may be exercised by the issuer under certain circumstances
name: relates the redemption provision of a debt instrument to one-time provision that may be exercised by the issuer under certain circumstances

id: bond secured by a limited revenue source, such as receipts derived from a designated project
name: bond secured by a limited revenue source, such as receipts derived from a designated project

id: Bonds.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from additional FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.
name: Bonds.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace concepts from additional FIBO FND ontologies with their counterparts added to the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1.

id: interest-bearing bond issued at a deep discount to face value
name: interest-bearing bond issued at a deep discount to face value

id: An original issue discount (OID) is the discount in price from a bond's face value at the time a bond or other debt instrument is first issued. The OID is the amount of discount or the difference between the original face value and the price paid for the bond.
name: An original issue discount (OID) is the discount in price from a bond's face value at the time a bond or other debt instrument is first issued. The OID is the amount of discount or the difference between the original face value and the price paid for the bond.

id: bond with a feature whereby the issue can be partially called for amounts that are at the discretion of the issuer
name: bond with a feature whereby the issue can be partially called for amounts that are at the discretion of the issuer

id: Most exchange traded bonds are corporate bonds (but most corporate bonds are not exchange traded bonds).
name: Most exchange traded bonds are corporate bonds (but most corporate bonds are not exchange traded bonds).

id: debt security issued by the government of a country
name: debt security issued by the government of a country

id: bond that has a floating interest rate
name: bond that has a floating interest rate

id: call triggered by some regulation-specific rule
name: call triggered by some regulation-specific rule

id: bond that gives the holder the right to convert the bond into a fixed number of shares (conversion ratio) if the equity price rises above a specified level (strike price)
name: bond that gives the holder the right to convert the bond into a fixed number of shares (conversion ratio) if the equity price rises above a specified level (strike price)

id: debt security issued by a government to fund government spending
name: debt security issued by a government to fund government spending

id: indicates the offset from the coupon payment date on which the rate is reset
name: indicates the offset from the coupon payment date on which the rate is reset

id: specifies the date on which bonds are awarded to the lead manager or syndicate on negotiated deals, or the date of bidding on competitive deals
name: specifies the date on which bonds are awarded to the lead manager or syndicate on negotiated deals, or the date of bidding on competitive deals

id: indicates the first date on which the bond may be called for redemption at a price above par
name: indicates the first date on which the bond may be called for redemption at a price above par

id: Corporate bonds are issued for purposes such as mergers and acquisitions, business expansion, or to cover ongoing operational needs, and are typically longer-term debt instruments that have a maturity of at least one year. Corporate debt instruments with maturity shorter than one year are referred to as commercial paper.
name: Corporate bonds are issued for purposes such as mergers and acquisitions, business expansion, or to cover ongoing operational needs, and are typically longer-term debt instruments that have a maturity of at least one year. Corporate debt instruments with maturity shorter than one year are referred to as commercial paper.

id: CO's are similar to GO bonds, except that they do not require voter approval before they are issued. The CO's are also guaranteed by the City's taxation power and are counted in the calculation of the tax rate that is needed to support debt payments.
name: CO's are similar to GO bonds, except that they do not require voter approval before they are issued. The CO's are also guaranteed by the City's taxation power and are counted in the calculation of the tax rate that is needed to support debt payments.

id: municipal bond that is backed by the full faith and credit and general resources of the issuing municipality, including its general taxing authority
name: municipal bond that is backed by the full faith and credit and general resources of the issuing municipality, including its general taxing authority

id: This need not be any specific type of bond. This is NOT a kind of Bond Contract but a kind of Issue Offer, and is modeled as such, in the Issuance Terms section of the model. This class of contract is retained in the model for now in order to provide traceability with the CFI term for "Bond With Warrant" only.
name: This need not be any specific type of bond. This is NOT a kind of Bond Contract but a kind of Issue Offer, and is modeled as such, in the Issuance Terms section of the model. This class of contract is retained in the model for now in order to provide traceability with the CFI term for "Bond With Warrant" only.

id: The last coupon date sometimes occurs at an irregular time; that is, if the bond pays coupons every six months, the last coupon period may be longer or shorter than six months.
name: The last coupon date sometimes occurs at an irregular time; that is, if the bond pays coupons every six months, the last coupon period may be longer or shorter than six months.

id: With a 10-year noncall 3-year ("10nc3") debt security, the security cannot be called for the first three years.
name: With a 10-year noncall 3-year ("10nc3") debt security, the security cannot be called for the first three years.

id: Bonds.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: Bonds.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: BABs may be direct pay subsidy bonds or tax credit bonds.
name: BABs may be direct pay subsidy bonds or tax credit bonds.

id: variable income bond whose principal is indexed to inflation or deflation and thus changes over the life of the security
name: variable income bond whose principal is indexed to inflation or deflation and thus changes over the life of the security

id: It doesn't carry an explicit full faith and credit guarantee but the market believes the government wouldn't let it default or fail.
name: It doesn't carry an explicit full faith and credit guarantee but the market believes the government wouldn't let it default or fail.
